result.execSummary:
The defendant April A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. April A Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • April A Jones was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April A Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DVD of March 17, 2014 Interview with April Jones - 201400003422

Defendant April A Jones in court/custody with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CM81. Called 8:53 am. Judge Bloom is appearing via phone from Oneida Co. Have resolution. Will plead to count 1 in 14CF34 and to the only count in 14CM81 must plead guility plus costs and surcharges. In 14CF34 9 months jail plus costs/surcharges consecutive to 14CM81. 187 days credit per agreement of all parties. 14CM81 90 days jail with costs/surcharges. All other counts dismissed. Court dismisses counts 2-6 in 14CF34. Jones pleads guility to count 1 in 14CF34 and count 1 in 14CM81. State has complied with victim notification and no restitution requested by victim of this defendant. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering her plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering her plea and waiving her constiutional right to JT, factual basis, adjudges guility of count 1 in 14CF34 and count 1 in 14CM81. State/Kessler makes final statement. Jones apologizes. Court sentences to the following: 

14CF34 - count 1 - 9 months jail with costs/surcharges (DNA surcharges apply) - huber allowed - 187 days credit consecutive to 14CM81

14CM81 - count 1 - 90 days jail with costs/surcharges (DNA surcharges apply)  - huber allowed.

Kessler asks for stay on the costs due for stated reasons. State asks pay w/in 60 days upon her release from incarceration. Court will order 60 days to pay once released from jail and can petition court to address amounts due at that time. Appeal rights given. Adj. 9:23 am.
Clerk forwarded to FOSO.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim.

Called at 2:04 PM. Also called 14CM81. April Jones appears in person and in custody with counsel Sheila Kessler. State appears by Charles Simono. Court has reviewed the motion filed in this matter and is ready to rule on it but will allow counsel to make final argument if they wish. State - nothing further. Kessler - nothing further. Court makes ruling - only a misd battery has been committed by Ms. Jones and amends complaint to conform to the evidence, complaint to include a single count of misd battery and case should proceed as a misd action. State - believes should proceed to ARGN on a misd charge and informs Court that it will be re-filing charges within 72 hours. Kessler makes statement regarding re-filing of charges unless there is newly discovered evidence. Court reviews statutes regarding re-filing of charges - refiling with additional evidence is proper - will grant the State 72 hours to do so. Kessler - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court asks about residency for the defendant. State responds. Defendant states she would be going to New Hope Shelter and states she does not have any income at this point but has a plan to get a job and states there is another source of income. Court - bond - reduces bond to $1000.00 cash bond - grants State 72 hours to re-file complaint. JA's wil contact counsel for purposes of future scheduling. Court continues bond on 14CM81. State mentions possibly issues with time limits for INIT for stated reasons. Kessler would be available on Friday if needed. Court will try and accomodate the state's schedule regarding holding an INIT prior to Judge Bloom's absence - State to fax complaint to Bloom's office as well.
Plaintiff's brief in opposition to Defendant's motions to dismiss their respective informations
for adjournment of filing date granted-
From District Attorney - Request for Adjournment of Filing Date

Called at 3:48 PM. April Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Sheila Kessler. State appears by Charles Simono. Court has moton to dismiss filed by defense counsel. Court has read defense counsel's arguments and has reviews portion of the filed transcript. State asked in previous case for a chance to file brief in regards to motion. Kessler states motion - if Court rules in defendant's favor - she will be looking for bond modification in this case. Court will take this motion under advisement and will allow the State until 6/20/14 to make written arguments and will allow defense counsel until 6/27/14 for any possible response. Court may take written action immediately upon completion of reviewing briefs filed and transcripts - will take the matter up on 7/28/14 or prior in writing, continues bond at this point and will also address bond prior to 7/28/14 if ruling is in favor of defendant.
and motion to dismiss information
state
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Called at 1:35 PM. Also called 14CF32, 14CF33, 14CF35 and 14CM81. April Jones appears in person and in custody with counsel Sheila Kessler. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with her counsel Brian Bennett. Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with counsel Michael Hughes. Samantha McClellan appears in person and with counsel Thomas McClure. Court has reviewed the motion that was filed by Attorney McClure for his client. All counsel ready to proceed to ARGN today, all counsel willing to waive reading of Information, all counsel pleads NG to all counts on all complaints. Kessler stands mute and asks court to enter NG plea on her behalf. Court does. State and counsel wish to schedule all matters for PTC, Bennett will be filing at least one motion prior to PTC and wishes to extend 10 day time limit for that, Kessler joins in on that statement as well. McClure wants his motion heard ASAP, other counsel OK with getting motion hearing date after PTC. Court sets 13CF35 for motion hearing on 6/3/14 at 3:00 PM and PTC on 7/28/14 at 3:00 PM, state to submit any responses 7 calendar days prior to 6/3/14, all other cases will be set for PTC on 7/28/14 at 1:30 PM, counsel to work with JA Shawl for motion hearing dates, court continues bond on all cases, grants extension of 10 day period time for filing motions, adjourned.
Arraignment on May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
4/9/14 proceedings

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: #1 - Sgt. Ashbeck's report; #2 - Dr. Maldonado's report; #3 - Tonya Malone's statement

Called at 3:46 PM. Also called other co-defendants cases of 14CF32, 14CF33 and 14CF35. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison appearing specially for Brian Bennett; April Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Sheila Kessler; Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with attorney Michael Hughes and Samantha McClellan appears in person and with counsel Thomas McClure. State calling one witness out of order for stated reasons. State calls Dr. Ivan Maldonado. State will have to recall him later as he is not available. State now calls Deputy Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 3:54 PM. Direct exam by State. State marks exhibit #1. Record reflects proper identification of defendant Justin Bey. State offers exhibit #1 (4:21 PM). Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (4:23 PM). Court reflects proper identification of defendant Raymond Jones. Court reflects proper identification of defendant April Jones. Record reflects proper identification of Samantha McClellan. Cross exam by Michael Hughes at 4:27 PM. State objects - relevance. Galen-Bayne Allison objects - relevance. Court sustains objections. Statre objects - relevance. Bayne-Allison - no foundation. Court sustains both objections. State objects - no reason. Court overrules. State objects - relevance - overruled. Cross exam by Sheila Kessler at 4:34 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 4:37 PM. Ashbeck steps down momentarily to contact another witness - Dr. Ivan Maldonado. State calls Dr. Maldonado sworn in at 4:40 PM. Direct exam by State. All counsel stipulates to Dr. Maldonado's qualifications. Kessler objects to the fact that the doctor may be testifying from medical records and they do not have copies of them for today's proceedings. Court instructs. Witness verifies. State asks the witness to only testify off the medical records from his facility and no other facilities. Court makes copies of these records for all counsel. Cross exam by Michael Hughes at 4:59 PM. The report that the doctor was referring to is marked as exhibit #2, received after no objectons (5:00 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained. No questions from Kessler or Bayne-Allison. Cross exam by McClure at 5:07 PM. Dr. Maldonado excused at 5:09 PM. Ashbeck retakes the stand at 5:09 PM, still under oath. No more questions by counsel. Ashbeck excused at 5:09 PM. State calls Lieutenant Karcz. Karcz sworn in at 5:10 PM. Direct exam by State. Court instructs all witness to not use childrens names during testimony (5:14 PM). Cross exam by Hughes at 5:29 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 5:31 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (5:32 PM). Karcz excused at 5:32 PM. State calls Captain Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 5:32 PM. Direct exam by State. McClure objects - sustained (5:43 PM). State marks exhibit #3 and offers exhibit #3 (5:46 PM). Court receives exhibit #3 after no objections (5:47 PM). Recess at 5:48 PM. Recalled at 5:59 PM. Direct exam continues. Cross exam by Hughes at 6:01 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (6:02 PM). Cross exam by Kessler at 6:02 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 6:03 PM. Cross exam by McClure at 6:04 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (6:05 PM). Re-direct by State at 6:06 PM. Re-cross by McClure at 6:08 PM. Court has questions of witness. Re-direct by State at 6:10 PM. Marvin excused at 6:11 PM. State relies on testimony rather than further argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was commited by Justin Bey and Raymond Jones. State makes argument for Court to find probable cause on Samantha McClellan but willing to concede on April Jones for stated reasons. Kessler makes argument - does not believe State has met its burden at this point - asks for dismissal of felony counts. McClure makes argument - does not believe State has met its burden at this point - asks for dismissal of felony counts. State responds. McClure makes final rejoinder. State responds. Court makes ruling on McClellan and April Jones - finds probable cause that both these individiuals committed a felony - binds both over trial. Court continues bond on all defendants, set all matters for ARGN. Hughes files a joined defendants request for substitition of Judge on all cases. Court accepts request for substitution.
LPG
and certificate of appearance - JM
and certificate of appearance - AK

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 1:06 PM. April Jones appears via video from FOSO and her attorney Sheila Kessler appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Kessler has complaint but has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant but waives further reading. Kessler is willing to waive time limits for a PH for stated reasons. Jones agrees. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 4/9/14 at 3:00 PM.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim.
$25,000 cash set
